question: If January 1, 2016 was a Friday, what day of the week will be on January 1, 2017?
answer: The year 2016 is the leap year which has 366 days i.e. 52 weeks and 2 more days. After each week, the day starts repetition. So the day on January 1, 2017 will be 2 days beyond Friday. That is Sunday.

A man sold two watches at the same price, one at a 10 % profit and the other at a 10 % loss. Find his overall gain or loss percentage.
answer: Let the selling price of each watch be Rs. 99 S => Total SP = Rs. 198 S CP of first watch = SP – Profit = Rs. 99 S- 10 % of CP = Rs. 90 S CP of second watch = SP + Loss = Rs. 99 S + 10 % of CP = Rs. 110 S => Total CP = Rs. 90 S + 110 S = Rs. 200 S => Loss = Total CP – Total SP = 200 – 198 = Rs. 2 S Therefore, loss percent = (Loss / CP) x 100 = (2 S / 200 S) x 100 % = 1 %

question: A policeman sighted a robber from a distance of 300 m. The robber also noticed the policeman and started running at 8 km/hr. The policeman also started running after him at the speed of 10 km/hr. Find the distance that the robber would run before being caught.
